intro: Gaertnera rakotovaoana, commonly known as the Rakotovaoana hibiscus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has palmate leaves with a distinctive veining pattern, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Gaertnera rakotovaoana is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
